definition: the money system of China
the unit of money in China
the group of people who are elected to make and change the laws of a country
the parliament of some countries, including the United Kingdom. In the UK, Parliament consists of the House of Commons and the House of Lords
a particular period during which a parliament is working; Parliament as it exists between one general election and the next
the large root of a tropical plant that is cooked as a vegetable
a type of large fruit with hard skin and a soft inner part. Gourds are often dried and used as containers.
to increase something as much as possible
to make the best use of something
the round surface on a record player that you place the record on to be played
a large, round surface that is able to move in a circle and onto which a railway engine is driven in order to turn it to go in the opposite direction
a wooden structure that is fixed to the side of a boat or ship in order to keep it steady in the water; a boat fitted with such a structure
three times; in three ways; three times as much
a large creature like a bear or a man covered with hair that some people believe lives in the Himalayan mountains
to argue with somebody in order to reach an agreement, especially about the price of something
the use of elements of game-playing in another activity, usually in order to make that activity more interesting
a sudden short period of angry behaviour for no good reason
giving your attention to something because you enjoy finding out about it or doing it; showing interest in something and finding it exciting
in a position to gain from a situation or be affected by it
a person who behaves in a practical and sensible way rather than having fixed ideas or theories
a type of small deer, originally from South-East Asia
to store something in a safe or secret place
twisted together in an untidy way
complicated, and not easy to understand
not made by or belonging to a particular company
the fact of doing something together or of working together towards a shared aim
a desire to be helpful and do as you are asked
the large muscle at the back of the top part of the arm
a strong feeling of opposition, anger or hate
based on your own ideas or opinions rather than facts and therefore sometimes unfair
existing in somebody’s mind rather than in the outside world
the subjective case is the one which is used for the subject of a sentence
an action, an object or a system by which a result is achieved; a way of achieving or doing something
the money that a person has
used to say that you are very willing for somebody to have something or do something
using dishonest methods if honest ones do not work
with the help of something
not at all
bad or unfair methods of doing something are acceptable if the result of that action is good or positive
a thing or an action that is not interesting or important in itself but is a way of achieving something else
the methods and materials available for doing something
extremely bad or serious
punishing somebody in an extreme way when they break a particular set of rules
not kind or showing sympathy; not smiling or showing approval
extremely difficult and requiring a lot of skill or ability
extremely plain and without any decoration
a hard hit that makes an opponent fall to the ground and be unable to get up, so that they lose the fight
a person or thing that is very attractive or impressive
a competition in which the winning player/team at each stage competes in the next stage and the losing one no longer takes part in the competition
that is likely to kill somebody
